events.name: Skylink WebRTC Training - When, why, how?
events.description: If you're curious about the capabilities of WebRTC or Skylink and want to understand better what it does, when to use it and how, this is the training for you. We welcome specifically commercial outlets, outsourcing companies, digital agencies, startups and freelancers that want to understand the technology better and get to know how it can help them creating better experiences in the future and stand out of the competition by being able to embed real-time audio/video communication and low-latency data exchange into apps and websites. Nontheless, everybody is welcome. App and web developers are encouraged to bring their laptop and any other phone/tablet/smartwatch that they'd like to outfit or get to use with WebRTC. Spread the word and forward this to people that you think can benefit from this training! See you soon!
events.location: JFDI Asia, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #05-16, Singapore

events.name: April meetup in a new place accepting Bitcoin
events.description: Hi Everyone, A new place in Arab St area wants to start accepting Bitcoin. Let's meet up over there and show them some love. They have beer ($10 for pint of draft Paulaner lager, $45 for 5 bottles of craft amber ale and other beers), cider, cocktails and fantastic coffee. No proper meals in the evening, so grab your dinner elsewhere before the meetup (pro tip: Artistry already has evening kitchen and accepts Bitcoin ;-) Bye, Tomas

events.name: Hackware v0.6
events.description: Talks : 1. HackRF and GNURadio - amateur radio platform up to 5.8GHz - Michał J. Gajda Lightning Talks : - Tessel - Ben Looi - Jarvis, a smart medical tablet jar - Team Jarvis with Mohit Singh Kanwal - Raspberry Pi motion-activated light switch - Kai Hendry

events.name: Git Meetup 0.1.0: "Initial commit" (and 10th Anniversary!)
events.description: It's Git's 10th anniversary, and we're having our first ever Git user meetup in Singapore! This meetup is aimed at both beginners and people who have over 10 years of Git experience (wait a minute…). We hope to stretch your Gitability level, and better your understanding of version control systems! Programme: - "A brief history of Git": Sahil Bajaj - "Git for Teams": Sayanee Basu - "Git Internals": Chow Loong Jin - Lightning talk: "Git commit messages": Rahul Gokul - Five random Git tips: ChernJie Come merge with your fellow Gits! Interested in speaking? Please talk to Valentine or ChernJie! (We're looking for lightning talks!)
